dfischer.utils

Class HexString

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.HexString

  • public class HexString
extends java.lang.Object
    Converts binary data to characters in hexadecimal format.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HexString(byte[] binaryData) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char getByteAsChar(int index)
      Returns a byte of the binary data in ASCII format.
      java.lang.String getByteAsHex(int index)
      Returns a byte of the binary data in ASCII hexadecimal format ("00".."FF").
      java.lang.String getByteAsHtmlChar(int index)
      Returns a byte of the binary data in ASCII-HTML format.
      java.lang.String getBytesAsChars()
      Return the binary data in ASCII format.
      java.lang.String getBytesAsHex()
      Return the binary data in hexadezimal format.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • HexString

        public HexString(byte[] binaryData)
        Parameters:
        binaryData - binary data

    • Method Detail

      • getByteAsHex

        public java.lang.String getByteAsHex(int index)
        Returns a byte of the binary data in ASCII hexadecimal format ("00".."FF").
        Parameters:
        index - byte offset (0..n-1) within the binary data
        Returns:
        the value of the byte in ASCII hexadecimal format

      • getByteAsChar

        public char getByteAsChar(int index)
        Returns a byte of the binary data in ASCII format. Note: this method does not convert the byte to hexadecimal format.
        Parameters:
        index - byte offset (0..n-1) within the binary data
        Returns:
        the value of the byte in ASCII format, or a '.' if the value of the byte is less than 32 or greater than 126

      • getByteAsHtmlChar

        public java.lang.String getByteAsHtmlChar(int index)
        Returns a byte of the binary data in ASCII-HTML format. Note: this method does not convert the byte to hexadecimal format.
        Parameters:
        index - byte offset (0..n-1) within the binary data
        Returns:
        the value of the byte in ASCII-HTML format, or "¿" if the value of the byte is less than 32 or greater than 126

      • getBytesAsChars

        public java.lang.String getBytesAsChars()
        Return the binary data in ASCII format.
        Returns:
        the binary data in ASCII format. All special characters are converted to a dot.

      • getBytesAsHex

        public java.lang.String getBytesAsHex()
        Return the binary data in hexadezimal format.
        Returns:
        the binary data in hexadezimal format. The bytes are separeted by space characters.
